column2: The daggers were created by the Dúnedain of Cardolan during their war against the Witch-king of Angmar.  After the fall of Cardolan, at least four of these daggers ended up in the tomb of the last prince of that realm who fell in T.A. 1409.
column3: Les dagues furent créées par les Dunedain du Cardolan durant leur guerre contre le Roi-Sorcier d'Angmar. Après la chute du Cardolan, au moins quatre de ces lames furent placées dans la tombe du dernier Prince du Cardolan, aux alentours de 1409 TA.

column2: The Morgul-blades, also known as "Morgul-knives", are magical and poisonous daggers used by the Ringwraiths in Middle-earth during the Third Age. The blade is cursed, and any wound it inflicts will poison the victim's soul, themselves becoming a wraith. After it pierces the flesh, the dagger breaks, leaving the shard of the blade in its victim.

Sting, an elegant and short blade with Elven runes engraved in the lower hilt that curl up to the middle as the text goes on. The blade its self takes upon a leaf like shape as it grows wider the further from the hilt it goes. A smaller hand fits near perfectly as it fits snuggly in between the curved cross-guard and the shining pommel. When orcs are nearby the enchantments placed upon it by its' maker cause it to glow with a light and vibrant blue.
Ce personnage possède Dard, dague forgée par les Elfes du Premier Age, à Gondolin, et trouvée par Bilbo dans l'antre de trolls.

column1: #Swords known to be around in the 3rd age

column2: Narsil, the sword of Elendil. It's a masterpiece of the First Age with a elegantly arched pommel that extends through the shining pommel and into the rounded crossguard. The blade is of longer length as is the hilt, due to the larger size of the wielders in question. The blade its self is both a deadly weapon and a powerful symbol of Gondor.

The shards of Narsil, the base and remnants of the blade which broke when fighting Sauron. Though shattered it still holds its edge as it can cut through flesh with ease. The shards are allegedly destined to be reforged once more for the true king of Gondor.
column3: Narsil était l'épée du Roi Elendil. Elle fut brisée lors de la Guerre de la Dernière Alliance, Isildur se servant de la garde pour trancher le doigt de Sauron, lui faisant perdre ainsi l'Anneau Unique. Les fragments de l'épée sont conservés à Fondcombe, mais restent la propriété des héritiers d'Isildur.

column2: Anduril, the Flame of the West. Reforged from the shards of Narsil, Anduril proves to be just as great a blade with all the power as the sword of old. A representation of rulership of Gondor in many aspects, this blade serves also as something for men to rally behind.
column3: Ce personnage possède Anduril, la flamme de l'Ouest, forgée à partir des fragments de Narsil.

column2: A blade forged long ago in the First Age, Glamdring proves to be yet another stroke of brilliance from Beleriand. The rounded pommel contains a light golden hue shared by the rest of the hilt and crossguard, though the hilt is wrapped in a fine deep blue. The blade its self extends with an oddity in the slightly longer curve on the left side of its base.
column3: Ce personnage possède Glamdring, une antique et puissante épée, forgée par les Elfes du Premier Age, et qui a appartenue jadis à Turgon, roi de Gondolin. Elle a été trouvée par Gandalf dans l'antre de trolls. Son nom signifie "Marteau à Ennemis"

column2: Forged alongside Glamgrind, Orcrist is a shortsword of elvish making. The fine wooden hilt leads up to a curved blade which has a streak of runes running through that along with the rest of it, light up in the presence of orcs. This tendrils of runes eventually curves up to the middle of the blade before the rest goes on to the tip.
column3: Ce personnage possède Orcrist, une antique et puissante épée, forgée par les Elfes du Premier Age, à Gondolin. Son nom signifie "Fendoir à Orques", et elle inspire la terreur parmi les Gobelins et les Orques.

column2: Herugrim, mark of a Rohirric king and an ancient blade. The brass holds many intricate carvings within the rounded pommel as it leads up to a dark red leather wrapping around the hilt. A heart shaped crossguard extends up to the base of the blade that continues up to the shining tip.
column3: Herugrim, l'épée du roi Théoden du Rohan. Son nom signifie "Epée farouche".

column2: This is Gúthwinë, the sword of the house of Eofor. It holds a good deal of resemblence to Guthwine with its brass carvings in the pommel and the dark red leather around the hilt. Despite the similarities it holds one notable difference in the crossguard in the form of a shining gold dragon thats tail and head wrap to the front with its back and wings spread out on the other side. Several lines cut into the blade all the way across up to the tip of the sword which causes light to reflect better and release a brilliant shine when in battle.
column3: Ce personnage possède Gúthwinë, épée appartenant à la maison d'Eofor. Son nom signifie "Amie de la Guerre". Elle est portée par Eomer du Rohan lors de la Guerre de l'Anneau.

column2: Wielded by Amroth an ancient king of Lothlorien, this blade bears many similarities to traditional elvish crafting. With its curved wooden hilt holding numerous carvings of careful design it has been fit perfectly for the king's hand. The metal its self bears the same fine craftsmanship as carvings of elvish runes are put through the base and up to the area where it curves towards a sharp tip.

column1: # Swords of the 2nd age, or 1st age swords not confirmed to be destroyed

column2: Blade of the King of Doriath Elu Thingol, this blade eventually passed down to the rulers of Numenor in the 2nd Age. Aranruth began with a silver pommel curving inward towards the hilt which lead to a shining and brilliant green emerald in the center of the crossguard. To the side of this emerald was silver curves resembling wings and upward lines of jade wrapped around the gleaming blade.
column3: Aranrúth était l'épée du Roi Elu Thingol de Doriath. Plus tard, cette épée faisait partie du Trésor de Numénor.

column2: Ringil was the name of the sword of Fingolfin. With it he wounded Morgoth seven times in single combat after the Dagor Bragollach. Ringil glowed with an ice blue light and held an elegant curve from the upper half of the blade to the tip.
column3: Ringil était le nom de l'épée de Fingolfin qui, dit-on, brillait comme de la glace. Avec elle, il blessa Morgoth sept fois en combat singulier après Dagor Bragollach

column2: Beren Erchamion's shortsword, Dagmor's golden pommel held a slight curve around with lines to the diagonal points leading to the end. The hilt was a fine cobalt blue separated near the top by a ring of gold before continuing with the blue and up to a shining gold crossguard. The blade its self had a slight blue tint though it would be hard to notice from afar.
column3: Dagmor était l'épée de Beren Erchamion.

column2: Anguirel was one of a pair of iron-cutting swords forged by Eöl, the Dark Elf, from an iron meteorite. The blade was dark as its master holding a will of its own in some accounts, with a dark grey pommel and near black hilt. The dark curves of the crossguard were near matching with the metallic grey making up the sharp hilt.
column3: Anguirel était l'une des épées en fer forgé par Eöl, l'Elfe Noir, à partir d'une météorite.

column2: This sword belonged to Maedhros himself, and it's still sharp. It's a great weapon for an Elf Lord.
column3: Cette épée a appartenue à Maedhros lui-même, et elle est encore tranchante. Une arme de choix pour un Seigneur Elfe.

column2: Forged in the First Age, this beautiful elvish sword held a light birch hilt with carvings within the hilt made by a master wood worker. The blade's runes caused it to give off a beautiful blue glow when near the creations of Morgoth, as it ran up the hilt which had a slight bend to it and a pointed tip.
column3: Un artisan elfe a reforgé cette ancienne épée, forgée par les Noldor durant les Âges précédents. Il lui a redonné son tranchant, et la lame peut être de nouveau utilisée contre les ennemis de son propriétaire.

column2: An elvish blacksmith forged this sword. It was further enhanced to increase the martial skill of its wielder.
An elvish blacksmith forged this sword. It was further enhanced to increase the combat rating of its wielder.
An elvish blacksmith forged this sword. It was further enhanced to increase the combat rating and martial skill of its wielder.
An elvish blacksmith forged this sword, drawing on ancient techniques of artisans of Eregion.
column3: Un artisan elfe a forgé cette épée, en s'inspirant des anciennes techniques des artisans de l'Eregion.

column2: A dwarf blacksmith created this sword in the heart of a mountain, in order to kill any enemy.
column3: Un forgeron nain a réalisé cette épée au cœur d'une montagne, dans le but d'abattre n'importe quel ennemi.

column2: Durin's Axe was a great heirloom of the Dwarves of Durin's folk. It was the axe of Durin I, the father of the Longbeard dwarves. This axe is an example of the wealth which the old king had as it contains gold deeply set in the axe shaft before extending to the dark iron of the blade.

Dramborleg was the great axe that Tuor favoured over any sword. During the Fall of Gondolin the axe killed five Balrogs, and was eventually passed down the Numenorean royal line. The blade was an enchanting silver that resembled the wing of a swan as the other side of it curved to match the neck and head of one.
column3: Dramborleg est la Grande Hache de Tuor, qu'il préférait à toutes épées.

column2: Aeglos, or icicle in the tongue of man. This glaive was wielded by the famous last High King of the Noldor, Gil Galad. The dark wooden shaft extended for several feet into the silver base of the blade which had golden etchings of elvish runes within. The blade its self was by no means extraodinary except for its elvish enchantments as it glew when in the presence of orcs.
column3: Aeglos était le nom de la lance de Gil-Galad, crainte par l'Ennemi. Elle fut brisée lorsque Gil-Galad tomba au combat contre Sauron lui-même, sur les pentes de la Montagne du Destin.

column2: This spear was forged by the dwarven craftsmen of Erebor, and is a terrifying weapon for all enemies of his holder.
column3: Cette lance a été forgée par les artisans nains d'Erebor, et est une arme terrifiante pour tout les ennemis de son porteur.

column2: Belthronding was a mighty bow, made of black yew-wood, that was carried by the most famous archer of Middle-Earth, Beleg Cúthalion, Strongbow of Doriath
column3: Belthronding est un arc puissant, fait d'if noir, et porté par le plus grand archer de la Terre du Milieu, Beleg Cúthalion, Maitre des Archers de Doriath.

column2: A set of thick leather armor..
A set of leather armor reinforced by the addition of ringmail.
A set of very heavy chained mail.
A set of impressive armor usually worn by knights.
A sword slightly longer than a dagger.

Gandalf the Grey's staff is one of simple yet elegant design that reflects quite accurately on its wielder. A simple oaken wood with the occasional bump or notch and some knots in the wood even as it would likely further the link in the staff and Gandalf himself. The top of the staff begins to swirl in curves that extend around to a final point which acts as a cage to the tiny gem inside. Hidden away within the wooden shield is an enchanting gemstone letting off a brilliant radiance that lights even the darkest passes.
column3: Voici le baton de Gandalf the Grey, une aide précieuse pour un magicien.

column2: Perhaps the most pure artifact in all of Middle Earth, the Staff of Gandalf the White is an object of great beauty yet simplicity. As with all the staves of the Istari it begins with a simple and long shaft that eventually extends into a more intricate design better reflecting that of its wielder in some way or another. In this case, it extends into four white curves up that meet at the tip and between them all is interconnected wood that unifies the staff. Unlike most of the staves, this one does not contain a gem as its power flows more freely instead of being centralized in one object.
column3: Voici le baton de Gandalf the White, une aide précieuse pour un magicien.

column2: This helmet was made on the island of Numenor, and is stronger than all the ones you find in Middle-earth, except those of the Noldor. The helmet was usually a bright iron near color like silver which had a bump that ran up to the top made of gold.
column3: Ce casque a été fabriqué sur l'île de Numenor, et est plus résistant que tout ceux que vous trouverez en Terre du Milieu, hormis ceux des Noldor.
